intro: Schoenocephalium schultesii, commonly known as the Schultes' goldenhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow to orange inflorescences, which are composed of numerous tiny florets arranged in a radiate pattern. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
